summary:
“who is that behind u???!!!”

“IS THAT A GHOST!?”

“THERE’S A REALLY HOT GIRL BEHIND YOU!!!!”

Enid spins in her chair, and her scream surely peaks her microphone.

Wednesday, in all of her goth glory, stands right behind Enid with her usual deadpan look. “Enid, you’re live streaming.”

Or the AU where Enid is a YouTuber, and her fans can't stop asking about her goth roommate after she appears in one of the live streams.

Enid should have cut off the stream sooner.

Another Saturday night, and like most Saturday nights, Wednesday comes back to the dorm smelling of blood.

Enid and her viewers start to find a balance.

Sundays were made for sleeping in.

It's totally not a birthday date.

Breaking the law is a pass time for an Addams.

Enid lets go of her worries; it turns out pretty great for her.

They'll deal with the consequences in the morning.

The morning after.

They have an actual date this time.

Gomez visits his daughter, and future daughter-in-law.

Wednesday and Enid do a Q&A.

text:
“Hey everyone! I know I know, this isn’t one of my usual Saturday streams, but I have some free time since my last class got canceled today!”

Enid flashes her bright smile, twisting side-to-side in her desk chair. Enid has been recording and streaming videos for two months now, ever since one of her TikToks went super viral. It hadn’t been anything too special, just her showing off some nail art she did on her claws, but people loved it. Yoko talked her into doing some Youtube for the heck of it, and well - she kind of blew up on the website! Apparently, there’s not a lot of supernatural Youtubers, and so when a bright and colorful werewolf popped onto the scene, she got flooded with fans.

She doesn’t post often though, college life and all that. She also doesn’t really stream, like she really doesn’t do it, and not because she’s afraid of embarrassing herself live; no, it’s a much more serious and dangerous reason. It’s because she has a roommate, an entirely unique but deadly creature in the shape of a small, young woman named Wednesday Addams. And Wednesday made it very clear the moment Enid started doing videos that she didn’t want to be in any of them.

Of course Enid took that request very seriously, and there’s never been even a hint of Wednesday in her videos. Though that’s mainly because Enid only recorded or streamed on Saturdays. She had no clue what Wednesday did on Saturdays, all she knew is that it kept the goth girl out of the dorm until midnight, and she always came back smelling like blood. So, probably for the best that Enid didn’t know.

Enid giggles as the comments fly by, but she catches a few asking her the same question. “Oh, my roommate? It’s all good! It was just my class that got canceled so she shouldn’t be back for another hour.”

“Anyways! I thought it’d be fun to stream a game! I know, me?! Playing a game!?” Enid giggles again, clasping her hands together as she wiggles in her chair, “my bestie got Planet Zoo for me so I figured why not kill some time with you guys by starting a little zoo!”

Enid rolls in closer to her desk. “I will have to cut the stream at almost an hour though, but don’t worry, I’ll stream again later once my roomie is out of the room.”

She flashes another wide smile, but it slowly melts away as the chat starts to go really fast. “Huh? What’s up guys?” It takes her a moment before she can read some of the comments.

“who is that behind u???!!!”

“IS THAT A GHOST!?”

“THERE’S A REALLY HOT GIRL BEHIND YOU!!!!”

Enid spins in her chair, and her scream surely peaks her microphone.

Wednesday, in all of her goth glory, stands right behind Enid with her usual deadpan look. “Enid, you’re live streaming.”

“Wha-what are you doing here?!”

“This is my room as well.”

“No! I mean what are you doing out of class?!”

“Oh that, the explosion in the science hall had unleashed a slime monster into my history class. I'm saddened it didn’t happen during the lecture; it would have been terribly wonderful to see Professor Cross get dissolved by said monster.”

Enid sighs heavily, she quickly turns back around and puts her hand over her webcam. “Listen, I’m so sorry, if I had known your class was canceled too, I wouldn’t have started streaming, I know you don’t want to be caught on camera.”

“Hm, a little too late for that, Enid.”

“I know! I-I’ll make sure to delete the video and any clips, I’ll do my best to make sure you’re-”

“It’s fine, Enid, I’m not angry...though if your...chat, doesn’t stop making comments on my appearance, I’ll have to take my frustrations out on you.”

“WHY ME?!”

“Because you are responsible for them.”

“I’m not their mom!”

“I’m sure their actual mothers said that to them as well.”

Enid giggles, but she quickly slaps her free hand over her mouth. “Oh my goddess, you can’t just say that on stream!”

Wednesday arches an eyebrow, a slight smirk curling the corner of her mouth. “Why? Because it made you laugh?”

“No! I didn’t laugh at that!”

“Don’t lie, Enid, I know you enjoy my sense of humor. Also,” Wednesday reaches up and pulls Enid’s hands away from both the webcam and her mouth, “you can stop doing that, I will be leaving now so you may continue to entertain these parasites.”

Enid rolls her eyes, “they’re not parasites, they're my friends.”

“Hm, they’re leeches at best, latching onto you and stealing away your time from me.”

Enid’s gaze darts to the side, avoiding Wednesday’s dark eyes. “Well...you could hang around if you want to? Maybe stream with me?”

Wednesday huffs as she crosses her arms, “I’d rather have my eyes plucked out and my fingers cut off.”

Enid pales, “a simple no will do, Weds.”

“Where’s the fun in that?” Wednesday’s arms drop down to her sides, but then one hand comes up, and Enid’s chin is pinched between a curled index finger and thumb. “I take immense pleasure from watching you squirm.”

“Uh - um, We-Weds, my uh - my stream is still going...”

Wednesday arches an eyebrow, “I’m well aware, Enid.” She then jerks Enid’s head up and down a little, a dark chuckle leaving her lips as Enid whines. “I will stop tormenting you for now.” She lets go of Enid’s chin.

Enid pouts as she quickly fixes her headset. “You’re heading out then?”

Wednesday turns and goes over to her side of the room, disappearing from the camera’s view. “As I said, I will leave so you may make a fool of yourself before the masses.”

“Do you think if I’m not funny enough I’ll be beheaded?”

Wednesday narrows her eyes at Enid, “nice try, Enid, but you do not make a fitting jester within my court.”

Enid sighs, “one of these days I will make you laugh.”

“I do find you amusing, Enid.”

“I meant with jokes and not with embarrassing myself!”

“But that is when you are most hilarious.”

Enid points toward the door with a pout, “just get out.”

Enid’s viewers watch as her roommate’s hand comes back into frame and grasps Enid’s jaw. Enid whines as her cheeks are squished, pursing her lips out of her pout.

“Don’t make that face, Enid, it’s unbecoming on you.” The goth releases Enid’s jaw, she runs her knuckles along Enid’s jawline, and then gently cups Enid’s chin, her fingers ideally scratching the underside. “I prefer that disgustingly sunny smile...may I see it?”

Enid sighs, a soft smile blossoming on her face as she looks up at Wednesday. “Only because you asked.”

“Thank you, cucciola.” Wednesday gives a single tap to the underside of Enid’s chin before drawing back. “I’m leaving now, don’t drown in the cesspool.”

Enid’s nose wrinkles up in disgust, but she spins in her chair to watch Wednesday walk out. “Stop calling it that, and bye, stay out of trouble!”

Wednesday pauses at the door to throw one more haunting look over her shoulder at Enid. “I make no promises.” She steps out of the room and slams the door shut behind her.

Enid turns back to the camera with a heavy sigh. “So sorry about that guys! But that was my roommate, Weds, don’t mind anything she said, that’s just how she is.”

The chat’s response was immediate.

“ROOMMATE??!!!! TELL ME UR JOKING”

“i thought that was ur gf”

“hate to break it to u, but that was homosexual behavior”

“LMAO right ‘roommate’ yeah i also let my roommate touch me like THAT”

“Oh come on guys! She’s my best friend, we’ve been roommates since freshman year! So what we get a bit touchy with each other, I have fought tooth and nail to get Weds to this level of physical affection! We’re just friends, and even if I was interested in her - and I’m not! Weds doesn’t do romance, she’s like, never had a partner before and like, you guys saw her; there’s a very long line of people who are waiting for the chance to date Weds.”

“omg and they were roommates”

“gay”

“gay”

“homosexual”

“gay”

“idk u sound a bit jealous there, a lil desperate, something u wanna tell us”

“why lesbians so dumb????”

“You know what, I hope all of you drown in the cesspool,” Enid hisses, and the stream is cut short.

When Enid checks her Twitter a few hours later, she almost faints from her pure horror. More than a dozen clips tweeted at her, retweeted and liked by over a thousand people and the number just keeps climbing. The worst part? She watched one clip, where Wednesday stands out of frame and is grabbing her chin, asking for a smile, and Enid feels like she’s going to throw up when she sees how dreamily she stares up at her roommate; like a worshiper kneeling before their faceless god. All the stupid comments weren’t helping the growing pit in her gut, especially the ones from her so-called friends.

“Okay you little freaks, we’re having a talk before we dive into this stream.”

Enid’s claws are out, a perfectly done sunset gradient with dark purple clouds toward the tips; just recently done for her usual Friday Instagram posts and already with over five hundred likes. Of course, an average number, but one that is steadily growing and will reach a thousand by Sunday; but that’s beside the point. Enid growls, the noise reverbing in her chest as she talks in a voice far lower than her natural pitch and tone of chiming bells and saccharine.

“We are not talking about Weds, we are not going to make suggestive comments about my relationship with her, and we are especially not going to keep bringing up how hot she is and how you all want her to step on you!”

Enid’s voice is guttural at the end of her little rant. Her eyes glowing neon blue, almost white like the moon itself at this point. Her canines brush against her bottom lip, and the shape of her ears are more pointed and fur lined.

Wednesday sighs, a gentle smile curling the corners of her lips. The devastating, wild beauty of her wolf left her breathless and wishing for the day when Enid lost all control. However, she’ll settle with this bit of madness she has sown.

To tell the truth, Wednesday had not cared when Enid first brought up her plans of becoming a streamer. She was more than alright with Enid recording her videos whenever as long as it didn’t disturb her usual writing time. So what if faceless strangers on the internet caught glimpses of her in the background, she didn’t care for their opinions of her. However, what she did care for was how people viewed Enid.

Society as a whole is entirely retched with their thoughts on those who do not fit into their mold of what is “normal.” Enid is an eye-bleeding bright werewolf, with the beauty of a nymph and the temperament of a storm at sea. Who could not love her? Many people that’s who, the utter morons. However, despite her oddities, Enid still fitted the mold of what is expected of a young woman in this world, bright and girly, painted nails and blush upon her cheeks.

Wednesday was not like that though.

Dressed in black and blood, masculine clothes and the scent of cologne lingering on her skin. A dark and sullen gaze, never a hint of emotion upon her sharp face. Her nails are blunt and black, the only color upon her face being the natural light brown of her skin. Wednesday didn’t want her dark presence to cloud the judgment of the masses, so she did what she does best; kept herself out of Enid’s social life.

Though, it seems like she has jumped to conclusions. Not the first she has done that, and this will certainly not be the last time she does it.

A chuckle escapes Wednesday as she watches Enid’s viewers whimper and whine about their disappointment.

“but-but-but goth gf ;v;”

“pwease can we see her again??? we’ll behave, right guys, fucking say yes my dudes”

“to quote my newly founded King of Darkness ‘I make no promises’”

“i will pay to have her chokeslam me into the fucking ground”

“HEY! HEY!” Enid points a clawed finger at the camera. “WHAT DID I JUST FUCKING SAY?! YOU WANT ME TO STOP STREAMING?! I’LL FUCKING DO IT!”

Wednesday lets out another breathy chuckle, “mia preziosa lupa, your suffering is delicious.”

A light tap at her ankle draws her attention away from her phone to the task at hand. Wednesday shuts off her phone and tucks it away, she leans forward on the ball of her feet to track her target. The moonless night above sets the scene like a nightmare; her prey creeps through the more dimly lit and less traveled corridors, trying to sneak from her boyfriend’s dorm back to her own. Wednesday stalks from high above, her movements swift and silent, her small figure just another flicker of shadow against the black sky.

Zoe Baxter, werewolf, twenty-four years old, currently a senior and studying for a major in law; but most importantly, she was Enid’s ex. Their breakup happened a fortnight ago, caught cheating when Enid had dropped by unannounced to the other werewolf’s dorm. Baxter is fortunate Wednesday didn’t skin her that very night, as Wednesday had been too busy with soothing her injured wolf, providing what little warmth she could give. Now, Baxter’s time has finally come, her luck all dried up.

The moment Baxter pauses, takes the time to check something on her phone, Wednesday pounces. She lands in a low crouch right in front of the werewolf, causing her to startle and drop her phone. The shriek that was just beginning to leave Baxter’s mouth is cut off sharply as Wednesday springs forward, slamming palm against the underside of Baxter’s chin. Wednesday doesn’t stop her momentum; she angles her shoulder so the full weight of her tiny frame rams right into the solar plexus. Her other hand quickly comes up to wrap around Baxter’s throat, her fingertips pressing in tight to briefly stop the werewolf from regaining her breath.

Baxter’s back collides with the stone wall. She blinks hard a few times, before her eyes go wide and wild with terror as she finally sees who her attacker is. Wednesday bares her teeth in a satisfied grin.

“Let’s have a little chat, Baxter.”

Wednesday opens the door without a sound. The first thing to welcome her home is the howling laughter of Enid, and she feels the tension of her body break. Her shoulders soften, her back not as ramrod straight. She drifts in like a phantom, shutting the door without grabbing Enid’s attention. She takes a minute to admire her wolf, her makeup spilling around her desk in a chaotic order that only Enid understood. Applying a buttery yellow eyeshadow to her right eye with a steady hand despite her animated chatter.

“No, for real I’m telling the truth!” Enid said as she paused to glance at the fast-paced chat, wolfish grin pointed at the camera. “She just looked me dead in the eye and was all like ‘this is your problem now’ and shoved the whole garlic knot into her mouth, I literally screamed!” She barks in laughter again, turning back to her mirror. “Let this be a lesson when making friends with vampires, be careful not to end up with the crazy, reckless ones cause they will take years off of your life with their bullshit.”

Enid puts down her eyeshadow palette before picking up the mirror, she angles it around her face with a soft smile. “So, what are we thinking guys? I think a bit of pink at the inner eye will look-” the face of the mirror passes over the door, catching the reflection of Wednesday, and Enid lets out a bloodcurdling scream.

Wednesday smirks slightly.

“WEDNESDAY!” The smirk immediately melts away. “How many times have I told you not to do that?!”

The goth girl saunters over to Enid, “I stopped counting after the first week of rooming with you.” Wednesday reaches out and grabs Enid’s chin between her index finger and thumb. She turns Enid’s face up, leaning down a little with a small hum, “the yellow is...nice, but I think a darker color would compliment your eyes far better...hm, perhaps magenta.”

“Yo-you know about this kind of stuff?”

Wednesday releases Enid, standing up straight again, “of course, I pay attention when you ramble on about it.” She spares a glance toward the computer screen, and sighs heavily as she narrows her eyes. “Ah yes, hello leeches, I see you all are continuing to drain the life force from my roommate.”

Enid snorts, “you have no idea - oh god, not again!”

“WEDNESDAY THE KING HAS A NAME!!!!!”

“omfg how is that literally so perfect for her”

“looking good 2night king, where u been at???”

“hey ummmmm not to bring down the mood but uhhhh is that blood on your hand?????!!!”

Wednesday looks down at her hand, cocking an eyebrow slightly; she lifts her hand up so the viewers and Enid could now clearly see her bloody knuckles. “Hm, it would seem so. Worry not, Enid, it isn’t my blood.”

Enid sighs, rubbing her temples, “I figured, Weds, do I even want to know?”

“I’m sure you’ll hear the news soon enough,” Wednesday said as she reached into one of the inner pockets of her leather jacket. She pulls out a black handkerchief and starts wiping the blood from her knuckles, “apologies though, I didn’t mean to touch you with my sullied hand.”

“It’s fine, Weds, I don’t mind.”

“It seems like the leeches don’t mind either.”

“Huh? What do - I swear! If you guys don’t stop, this stream is over!”

“sorry daddy-i mean sorry daddy-i mean sorry daddy”

“no need to do that, i’ll lick the blood for you”

“OH so she actually beats people up coolcoolcoolcool, so like, when is my turn????”

“I can’t believe you’ve been hiding this national treasure from us Enid”

“You guys are so fucking weird!” Enid shouts, shooting up from her desk chair and knocking it back. “Can’t you guys be cool? Can’t you be chill like just a little bit? Can you stop embarrassing me in front of Wednesday!?” Enid pants a little bit, and then her lungs freeze up. She turns ever so slowly, and looks down at Wednesday. “Oh no.”

“HOLD UP HOLDUP OUR KING IS A SHORT KING!!!!”

“WTF I’M GONNA CRY SHE SO TINY”

“goth, butch, tiny af, she IS lesbian catnip”

“I need exact height NOW”

“I did the maths evryone and it says...too fucking small for this world”

"STOP BEING GREEDY ENID SHARE UR GF WITH US"

“ok what next, she’s good at sports?? can dance?? can play a goddamn guitar or something???”

Wednesday looks up at Enid, a slight smirk playing at her lips. “Oh Enid, have you told them that I pla-”

Enid’s hand slaps over Wednesday’s mouth, the tips of her claws leaving tingling pinpricks on Wednesday’s cheeks. The werewolf leans in, looming over Wednesday, “you know what, I think I’ll get a new roommate since my current one is so fucking annoying.”

Wednesday simply smirks against the palm of Enid’s hand, relishing in the glorious sight of her gorgeous, snarling wolf.

Enid looks through the newly discovered tag with absolute horror. Clips from the past two streams, featuring the two roommates and their banter and touches. Posts gushing over them and saying over and over again how lucky Enid was to have Wednesday. A lot of art of Wednesday, like a scary amount of art of Wednesday. Enid quickly exits the tag after seeing an especially spicy drawing of Wednesday that she refuses to think about in fear of passing out.

Enid hangs her head with a heavy sigh, burying her face into her hands. “This is really my life now.”

Her head snaps up as the door opens. Wednesday steps in, but pauses when their eyes meet. “Enid? Are you alright? You look-”

Wednesday never gets to finish her sentence as Enid launches herself at the goth. Fine, everyone wanted a goddamn kiss, she’ll give them a fucking kiss.

The goth ran on little to no sleep, staying up late until the early morning, Enid has woken up many times to see Wednesday’s bed empty, or her curled up with a book. Wednesday is laying on her stomach, her head turned toward the window, though her face is practically buried into the pillow. Midnight black hair spread out over the black sheets and pillow, absorbing the sunlight that dared to touch it. The blanket has fallen around her waist, revealing skin and ink that only Enid is allowed to see, to touch. Enid reaches out, and gingerly she brushes aside Wednesday’s long hair before her fingertips run over black lines. The snarling wolf is so life-like that sometimes Enid believes it’ll jump from Wednesday’s skin and maul her. Enid’s fingers dance from the shoulder blade, taking a moment to trail down the lunar cycle that follows Wednesday’s spine before it disappears under her tank top. Enid is just starting to trace the beak of a raven on Wednesday’s right shoulder blade, when the goth shifts a bit.

“Hm...Enid?” Her voice is heavy and husky with sleep, a single eye of obsidian squinting at the morning rays and at Enid.

Enid smiles softly, she crouches down and rests her chin on the edge of the bed, her hand still on Wednesday’s back. “Hey sleepy head, sorry for waking you.”

“It’s fine...did you need something?” Wednesday asks through a yawn.

Enid glances down at her phone that was still in her hand; she looks back to Wednesday with a bright smile. “No, I just wanted to say good morning.”

“Hm, terrible morning to you too.”

Enid moves her hand, she gently cards her fingers through Wednesday’s hair. “I’ll let you get back to your nightmares.”

Wednesday lifts her head a bit, nudging it against Enid’s hand. “If you desire my company I can get up.”

“No no, it’s okay, I know you need your hibernation.”

Wednesday huffs lightly, slumping back into her pillow, her voice muffled against the fabric, “it’s not hibernation, it’s a twelve hours long meditative state to allow my body-”

Enid cuts Wednesday off by tugging on her hair, “to recharge the energy needed for the week blah blah blah, I know Wednesday, I don’t need the Addams biology lesson, again.”

“...Enid?”

“Yeah?”

“...Can I go back to sleep?”

“Oh...right,” Enid stands up, ignoring the heat in her cheeks. “Oh! Also, thanks um, for handling the stream after I...you know.”

Wednesday shifts and stretches, sighing as she gets a few satisfying pops from her back. “It was no trouble,” she mumbles, flipping over onto her side so her back faced the window. “I’m sure the parasites took infinite joy from your misery.”

“God, I don’t want to look at Twitter.”

“Aw, poor gattina,” Wednesday coos, looking over her shoulder with half-lidded eyes and a lazy smirk. “Can’t take a bit of harassment from strangers?”

“You shut the fuck up,” Enid growls, “you’re not the one who has to deal with it.”

Wednesday hums softly as she looks away. “True enough, Enid, if they truly bother you, I can track them down and make them regret it.”

“That...thanks, Weds.” Enid rests a hand on Wednesday’s upper arm, and then she leans down and places a delicate kiss against Wednesday’s temple. “Have awful nightmares.”

“...Have a good day.”

“Wednesday.”

“Xavier.”

He steps aside and gestures for her to come in. “So you were able to lose your ball of sunshine for a few hours?”

Wednesday raises an eyebrow as she takes off her leather jacket. “Enid respects my privacy, I told her I had plans with a friend until the evening.”

“Will you two have enough time for your plans later?”

“Of course, you have a steady and fast hand, and I can handle the pain without a break, this should only take four hours at most.”

Xavier rolls his eyes as he locks the door, he goes over to the table pressed up against the left wall. “Well then, you know the drill, shirt and bra off.”

Wednesday takes off the thin turtleneck and folds it up neatly before removing her sports bra as well. She sets her clothes aside on a small table in the corner. She sighs as she sits backwards in the wooden chair in the middle of the shed; she crosses her arms and rests them on top of the backrest. Xavier steps in front of her with an eager smile.

“I have a few designs for you, but I thought you’d like this one the most,” he said, holding out the paper for her approval. “It’ll go under your wolf, and this part here will curl onto your ribs, framing the words there.”

“Hm, adequate...I’m sure Enid will find it lovely.”

Xavier flashes her a lop-sided grin, “that was kind of the point.”

Wednesday narrows her eyes slightly, “pardon me, but I believe this is permanently going onto my skin, not her’s.”

“Yeah, but she’ll be the one looking at it, helping you take care of it, dreamily trace the lines while you sleep...”

“...Do not abuse the things I tell you, Thorpe, just get to work already.”

Xavier laughs as he steps behind Wednesday, smiling as he views his favorite canvas once more. Wednesday has been his best friend since childhood, and she has always been a muse of his. She is handsome, a haunting beauty that is rare in this world, and when he first laid eyes on her it awoken a passion inside him. Despite what some people might say or think, their relationship has always been platonic. It didn’t matter if he drew her form nude or clothed, or drew upon her skin with needle or paint; their love is innocent, muse and artist, inspiration and drive to create.

He grins at the snarling wolf that crouches low on the upper half of Wednesday’s left shoulder blade. The beast looked ready to pounce from Wednesday’s skin, which it almost had back when he finished the piece. The lunar cycle down her spine was the last piece he did on her; the waxing crescent started on her sixth cervical vertebrae and the new moon ended on her eighth thorax vertebrae. Then there was the raven and the dove on her right shoulder blade; the two birds flew together towards an old, dying tree that had its roots running down Wednesday’s back to stop just above her lower back; and weaving between the roots were the names of Wednesday’s family.

These pieces however were just a few of what Xavier has done on Wednesday. The first ever tattoo he did on her was on her left foot; a black mamba biting into the right side of her ankle with its body wrapped once around her ankle then going over the top of her foot in a large S shape, the tip of the tail ending on the side of her big toe. The second piece is on her left rib cage, a poem by Emily Dickinson, and Xavier snickers whenever he sees it; the words to Wild Nights written in calligraphy done by Wednesday’s hand.

Which brought him to the newest piece he’ll be adding. He carefully laid the inked paper on the left side of her back, making sure it curled over her rib cage correctly to frame her poem. Once done he grabs a rag and wets it before pressing it against the paper.

“So, excited for your date today?”

“Not a date.”

“Says who?”

“Me, moron, we’re just going out to dinner.”

Xavier snorts, “right, if it’s so casual then what’s up with the outfit you planned?”

“...I don’t have to explain myself to you.”

Xavier laughs, slowly peeling the paper away from Wednesday’s back. “Just ask her out already! You know she’s into you, what’s there to worry about?”

Wednesday sighs softly, digging her chin against her forearm. “I...I enjoy what we have, her and I, it is...nice - simple, I worry my love might be too much for her to handle.”

“Come on, Nes, this is Enid we’re talking about, she is intense.”

“That she is, but the love of an Addams is obsessive, consuming and maddening...I have to be sure, I have to test her.”

“So formal,” Xavier mutters with a smirk. He sits down on his stool and picks up the tattoo gun, he dips the needle into some black ink before placing a hand on Wednesday’s arm. “Alright, you ready?”

“When am I never not ready?”

Xavier presses the pedal and the gun comes to lift with a dull buzz. He works in silence for the first twenty minutes before speaking up. “Forgot to ask, you want some music playing?”

Wednesday hums lightly. Xavier pulls away from her skin, and smiles a bit seeing her eyes closed, her body utterly relaxed. “Put on the playlist you made for me,” Wednesday mumbles, shifting her head to put her forehead against her forearms.

Xavier puts down the tattoo gun and quickly grabs his phone. It takes a few minutes before music fills the shed, People Are Strange being the first song of the afternoon. Xavier picks back up his tool and gets back to work.

“Did you get your presents from your parents yet?” He asks as he slowly follows a curving line.

“Hm, no, I imagine they’ll show up in a day or two; mother and father always send too many.”

Xavier nods, he pauses to carefully wipe the skin before continuing the line. “And your Uncle Fester?”

“Piercing kit.”

“For the last time, I’m not piercing your nipples, Wednesday, go to a professional for that; it’s already bad enough I let you bully me into doing your tattoos.”

Wednesday huffs as he pulls away to wipe away the excess ink again. “I’m not letting a stranger do it.”

Xavier rolls his eyes, “ask Yoko then, I’m sure she’d be down for it.”

“I’m not letting that idiot see my breasts.”

“Then shut up because I’m not doing it.”

“Drop dead, Thorpe, you’re no fun.”

Xavier chuckles, “listen, someone around here has to have common sense, and I can’t believe it’s me.”

Wednesday turns her head, her chin coming to rest on top of her bicep. “I have common sense, and it tells me to not trust the simpletons that work at the tattoo and piercing shop in Jericho.”

“Fucking god, you’re so weird,” Xavier mutters with a fond smile.

“...Will you at least pierce my tongue?”

“NO! Just get your uncle to do it!”

When Wednesday comes back to the dorm, she steps in on Enid pacing the width of the room. The blonde is dressed in a simple t-shirt and shorts, her face bare of any makeup.

“Enid? You haven’t gotten ready yet?”

Enid jolts a bit at Wednesday's question. She twists sharply, her eyes wide and glowing; her thumb nail trapped between her teeth. “Wednesday! Hey, sorry but no, after you left I realized I never asked about what I should wear and...well...” Enid glances toward her closest.

Wednesday follows her gaze, and she cocks an eyebrow seeing the mess scattered within and across the floor. “Ah, I see.” Wednesday fully comes into the room and closes the door behind. “Well then, we can simply get ready together, however, I require your help for a moment.”

Enid perks up, a beaming smile overtaking the nervous frown she had been wearing. “Of course! What do you need help with?”

Wednesday turns around, unzips her leather jacket, and shrugs it off to expose her bare back. Enid gasps the moment her eyes find the fresh ink. A field of flowers; lavender, tulips, daisies, violets, and a dozen other kinds fill up her skin until they reach the left side of her lower back. Swarms of butterflies littered the field, a few straying off to the side and fluttering over Wednesday’s rib cage. The snarling wolf now crouched over all of this, as if it was the guardian of this beautiful field of life; a few butterflies have been added around the wolf, and a few even dared to rest upon the fearsome animal.

Wednesday looks over her shoulder, hiding a smile by pressing her mouth against her shoulder. “I need to clean this up and put the coconut oil on.”

“Wow...so you were hanging out with Xavier, huh?”

Wednesday nods slightly, “apologies, I wanted it to be a surprise.”

Enid smiles tenderly, she closes the gap between them and runs her fingers like a breeze over the new lines. “It’s your birthday, silly, I’m not complaining.” Enid tilts her head, she shifts a bit so she can look at Wednesday’s rib cage. The butterflies form a border around the calligraphy that takes up most of the rib cage, “I never realized you had more tattoos, is this a poem?”

“Emily Dickinson, Wild Nights, one of my favorites.”

Enid takes a moment, mouthing the words to herself, and she’s grinning by the time she’s done reading the words. “You’re such a softie, Weds.”

Wednesday arches an eyebrow, “I am not, my love would kill you.”

“I don’t know about that, I’m a werewolf, we’re pretty hard to kill.”

“Hm, Baxter is a werewolf, and she could do nothing to stop me...but perhaps you will be a greater challenge.”

“Never know until you give me a try.” Enid flashed a grin full of sharp teeth.

A razor sharp smirk curls the corner of Wednesday’s mouth, “careful, Sinclair, I might take you up on that offer.”

Enid trails her hand down, and Wednesday feels the tips of claws gently dig into her lower back. “I hope you do, Addams.” Then in the blink of an eye, the claws shrink back and the glow leaves Enid’s eyes. She straightens up and claps her hand together. “Alright! Let’s get you cleaned up and ready for your birthday dinner!”

Wednesday follows Enid into the bathroom, “thank you, I would have Thing help, but it is a large piece, so two hands are better than one in this situation.”

Enid giggles as she has Wednesday sit down on the toilet. “It’s no problem at all, Weds! I love helping out.” Enid searches around for Wednesday’s soap. “I’m stunned by how much you guys got done in what...five hours?”

“You know I don’t need to take breaks during the sessions, the pain is hardly a tickle; and Xavier is good at what he does, the piece should be done in our next session.”

“I can’t wait! It’s gonna look absolutely gorgeous with all the shading done.”

Wednesday glances over her shoulder, “I’m thinking about getting something on my right rib cage next, I have found the pain to be most enjoyable there.”

Enid rolls her eyes, “you know, people usually get tattoos for the art, not for the pain.”

“Hm, I suppose...I desire to have my nipples pierced as well, but Xavier keeps refusing my request.”

There’s a loud clatter; Wednesday looks over her shoulder again, and smirks seeing several objects have fallen out of the wall cabinet and into the sink, or onto the floor. Enid is scrambling around to pick everything up with a beet red face.

“O-oh! I-I never knew yo-you wanted to do that!”

“I’m interested in how they feel, the same with a tongue piercing; sadly I’ll have to wait until I next see my Uncle Fester. Xavier demands I see professionals, but the idea of some stranger seeing me in such a state makes me want to crawl out of my skin.”

The fire sizzles out, but smoke still clings to his body, billowing from his mouth and pouring out from under his clothes. “Tell me it is the wolf you lament about every time you come home? Have you finally confessed your undying love?!”

Wednesday stills briefly, a faint redness taking her ears. “It was...not a confession per se.”

“Wednesday! Do not tell me you skipped proper etiquette and went right for the kill!”

Wednesday huffs, her eyes blacken into a deadly glare. “Do not scold me, you weren’t any better at my age; actually, you were younger and much worse than I, you took mother to bed within the hour of meeting her.”

Gomez holds up his hands, a sheepish grin on his face. “Alright, you got me there.”

“However, you are right, and that is why I am making up for that,” Wednesday turns her gaze back to her gift. “I will drown her with my affection, burn her alive with my love, she is my treasure and I will treat her like my finest gem in my horde.”

Gomez leans forward slightly, his eyes narrowing as he studies his daughter. “Wednesday...have you...changed since this development of your relationship?”

Wednesday pauses, and then with a nod she holds up her little project; a black scale, shaped into a heart, with a name slowly being etched into the steel hard surface. “Three days ago I grew scales, and my tongue became snake-like. Wednesday rolls her eyes, but she can’t help the fond narrowing of her eyes. “Should I expect...changes in my emotional behavior?”

“Call whenever you wish to, my little viper - oh! And do not forget to tell Enid that I’ll be coming over this Saturday for our duel!”
